question: I’m taken from a mine and shut up in a wooden case, from which I’m never released, and yet I’m used by almost every person. What am I?
Imagine you're in a dark room that is perfectly empty with nothing in it. There are no windows or doors. What is the easiest way to escape?
answers: Stop imagining you are in that room
Dig a hole in the ground with your bare hands
correct: Stop imagining you are in that room

question: I am full of holes but can still hold water, what am I?
Only one color, but not one size,Stuck at the bottom, yet easily flies,Present in sun, but not in rain,Doing no harm, and feeling no pain.What is it?
I repeat only the last word your say. The more i repeat, the softer I got. I cannot be seen but can be heard. What am I?
What is the difference between yesterday and tomorrow?
A man rode in town on Tuesday, and left two days later on Tuesday. How so?
answers: The time went back on Thursday
He went to China the next day

question: I have keys but open no locks. What am I?
I can fly without wings. I can cry without eyes. Whenever I go darkness follows me. What am I?
What is boneless but difficult to break?
On the left side of the road there is a green house, on the right side of the road there is a red house. So, where is the White House?
I have cities but no houses, forests but no trees, and rivers but no water. What am I?
Which month is the shortest of the year?
What surrounds the yard without ever getting tired?
What has six sides and twenty-one dots, but cannot see?
What is something that the more you have of it, the less you can see?
What do poor people have, rich people need, and if you eat it, you die?
What is the last thing that you will see before everything ends?
I am something that people make, save, change, and raise. What am I?
What is something that the person who makes it cannot use, the person who buys it cannot use, and the person who uses it cannot see or feel?
